meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Israel.
meanings.sent1: In Israel, you can use sheqels to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I paid for the souvenir with sheqels at the market.
meanings.sent3: The sheqels in my pocket jingled as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was worth more than all the sheqels in the world.
meanings.sent5: The shiny sheqels sparkled in the sunlight, tempting me to spend them.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to about 11.5 grams.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for two sheqels of flour.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler measured the gemstone in sheqels.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the heavy sheqels of gold was a workout.
meanings.sent4: His words had the sheqels of truth, heavy and undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The sheqels of silver gleamed in the scale, perfectly balanced.
